Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 636391010b138d25165a35a0db31ab4fddd53f78
commit heading looks incomplete. make sure you have an heading with 50 characters.

Need details on what this commit is about and what changes have been made.

Tested portion for this change is required.

Also provide the tested section which tells existing code isn't affected with this change
why did you remove blank line 15
please change the api names. now its to convert any type to string
please change the argument name and argument description
you need to check if T is of type vector/string and then proceed with this calculation. For other types, we can add the logic whenever required
Other types shouldn't be there, but will check whether this check is required. Thanks.

I agree with priyanga here. Who is going to ensure what value will be passed to the api.
In case on int it will break.
this logic works if T is of type vector or string. what if T is of type int/uint8_t? this will break. so have an explicit check to apply this logic only if T is vector or string.
There is no chance for that, as it will be array of one element even if it's there.

I agree with priyanga here. Who is going to ensure what value will be passed to the api.
In case on int it will break.
you can directly call this api getPrintableValue<string>(keywordVal); while emplacing
Format issue, please check these after you push a patch set.
How is it ensured that vec data type will have begin() and end().

can you please specify what the exact fix is in commit heading.
something like "vpd-tool:UTF-8 encoding support on hardware read"
data from H to readable format? can you specify what H is?
Sure, I think 'W" got out, will add that.
can you also test read from dbus case and add the tested section here.

you have same piece of code in  both the functions just with a change in parameter type. is this required?

This is where we use templated functions and whatever you did in the previous ps is right. but I wanted you to add a parameter type check inside your templated api. thats it. So that even if we pass value with any type, we won't crash the application.
Please undo these changes and add a type check in your templated api. that should be fine.
we did similar thing in ibm_vpd_app.cpp.

Or else, if you don't need templates, we can use std::variant as the parameter in your api.
Please use std::variant having type checks is not elegant.
Oh Okay, thanks. I'm okay with either of them, but we decided to have variant function, so did overloading. I'll check on std::variant, too.
We discussed that std::variant should be used then why two API's?
Same here, extra line. Please have a look yourself once you push a commit, these can be avoided.
Extra lines, please have a look around files after you push. At least these issue should not appear.
change the name from vec to something which is apt.
whats the purpose of having line 712?
ACK, but for return may need value for visit so have it outside.
If the given element is printable, at line 729, you take care of converting it to a string. thats fine, but whats the purpose of line 719?
the name 'Vec' doesn't give a meaning to the variant you have created. can you please specify a meaningful alias name here.
please change the doxygen description according to your changes

can you give a generic api name now? like toHexString().
and please change the doxygen description accordingly
can you please undo removing line 454

you can remove lines 467 and 468.

If there are any json exceptions, we don't need to stop displaying the value read from dbus. we still can display the value via std::cout. can you please add that change here?

we can keep e.what() in cout.

except for the kw SE, vpd-tool --fixSystemVPD is going to display all values in hex string only(even if it is printable). that's the reason I was using byteArrayToHexString() in line 753.

why do you want to change now?
I would like to discuss these changes.
I would like to discuss the requirement of this change here.
I would like to discuss the requirement of this change here.

Why you need to define it here? Does not add a value having variant called as variant.
Since used at only at one place, use it in place. Also using in place will be convenient to know what all types the variant support.
Okay, will change the name, but it's used in many a places so positioning here seemed good.

Clean up required to make code more readable. 
May the old code was also less readable, but when a change is made it is good to make the code more readable.
Can you please check previous patch too, if the changes are good to you. Thanks.

Suggestion:
bool getHexString(const Val& var, std::string result)

Make the function return bool and pass string to be filled as argument. 
As function can return false also.
Thank you. It was iterative change, so didn't want to change the function itself.Same for above
There may be no requirement for that as it'll change to hexString anyway.

Use better names. 
What does vec mean here?

This is not proper way to use get_if 

We need to check if the output is null pointer.

Use better names.
It helps make code more readable.
For these comments, it's been inherited from previous code, so didn't change, please check previous reviewed patch, if it's good.
Like mentioned above we need to check if get_if is null before we de-refer the pointer. Because if get_if return null then we will be de-referring a null pointer.

Can we just do 

return hexString(vec);

Why was this removed?
This was not mentioned in commit message.
This is not required here as is without functionality, it was added by mistake in previous commits.
Why line 726 is required? You can return from here itself?
No, it'll give error as visit is other function and may need to capture
Try to see if you can avoid such copies.
Yes, This can be inside visit or will return hexString()
Don't use using in header file and also Vec is not a meaningful name.
When you are using in place then why do you need a using at top. Please get rid of the "using" at top.
convertToStringInHex is a better function name
